results.title: The Sin of Harold Diddlebock
results.brief_description: Harold Lloyd was a born comedian. Depending more on a storyline than many of his slapstick contemporaries, Lloyd was famous for his timid, bespectacled, “nice boy” characters and for thrill-comedy situations, involving dangerous and daring stunt gags. The triumphant climax of “The Freshman” became the opening scene of “The Sin of Harold Diddlebock” in which, 22 years later, the football hero has become a bent, prematurely old clerk, who is about to be pensioned off early. The film is an hilarious chronicle of his reawakening to the joys of life, as he is plunged into a whirlwind of wild and crazy exploits. “The Sin of Harold Diddlebock”, a sound feature and Harold Lloyd’s last film was also issued under the title “Mad Wednesday”.

results.title: The Simpsons arcade cabinet
results.brief_description: The Simpsons arcade game set itself apart from other brawlers and TV game properties with the show’s main cast voicing the characters, who have unique weapons to swing at enemies. Unfortunately, Lee Carvallo isn’t in the game so you can’t use a three-wood golf club.
results.description:
The Simpsons had only screened one season when Konami released this side-scrolling beat em up in 1991. It wasn’t that Konami knew how successful The Simpsons would be, it’s that they already had the foundation for the game. Two years earlier they’d developed the Teenage Mutant Nina Turtles arcade game and applied the same mechanics to The Simpsons, which featured almost identical play style and button mashing combat. What set The Simpsons apart was the accurate voice renditions, with the TV show’s main cast voicing the characters in the game.

Players can control either Homer, Marge, Bart or Lisa as they use unique fighting techniques – punching or swinging a vacuum cleaner, skateboard or skipping rope – to rescue Maggie after she’s kidnapped by Smithers.

Unfortunately, Lee Carvallo isn’t in the game so you can’t swing a three-wood golf club.
description_for_label:
The Simpsons had only been on-air for one season when Konami released this four-player side-scrolling ‘beat em up’ in 1991. It wasn’t that Konami knew what a phenomenon The Simpsons would become, it’s that they already had the blueprints for the game. Two years earlier they’d developed the successful Teenage Mutant Nina Turtles arcade game and applied the same mechanics to The Simpsons, which featured almost identical play style and two-button combat.

What set The Simpsons apart was the accurate voice renditions of everyone’s favourite Springfield residents, with the TV show’s main cast voicing the characters in the game. Players control either Homer, Marge, Bart or Lisa as they use unique fighting techniques – punching, swinging a vacuum cleaner, skateboard or skipping rope – to rescue Maggie after she’s kidnapped by Smithers. Unfortunately, Lee Carvallo isn’t in the game so you can’t swing a three-wood golf club.

results.title: The Simpsons
results.brief_description: The Simpsons focuses on the antics and everyday adventures of a typical American family and the town of Springfield. A pop culture icon since its inception, The Simpsons is known for its fearless satirical takes on politics, media and American life.

constellations_other.name: Cartoon classics and criticism
constellations_other.description: A whole cavalcade of cartoons have successfully made the leap into arcades and onto consoles, but the relationship between cinema and videogames is far more likely to fizzle out.

constellations_other.name: Oh, no! Beta!
constellations_other.description: The Sony Betacam BVP-3P was a broadcast-quality camera that used Sony's Beta system, most commonly found in consumer cameras. During the Format Wars in the 1970s and 80s, Beta lost to the cheaper and more accessible Video Home System (VHS).

constellations_other.name: Transformations
constellations_other.description: Like many techniques born from the visual language of magic lanterns, the dissolve effect was incorporated into filmmaking and is still used today.

constellations_other.name: Nadia Tass
constellations_other.description: Comedic and cult classics take centre stage in Nadia Tass' career.

results.title: The Silver whistle
results.brief_description: A puppet animated fairytale, about a heroine who uses her magic whistle to break the spell of a beautiful but wicked witch, and charms a prince with her wit, goodness, prudence, and freckles. Designed to develop language arts skills. Charming and fey, this modern fairytale employs a crude and colourful animation style in the service of its gentle, whimsical nature.

results.title: The Silver haul
results.creator_credit: Guy Blanchard, James Mellor and Editorial Film Productions
results.brief_description: Details of the British herring industry including buying, selling, marketing and making a haul. Demonstrates the laying of the nets and landing of fish; the gutting and grading, either by hand of mechanically, of the catch which may be kippered, salted, qucik frozen or shipped fresh on ice. Summarizes the history of the industry.

results.title: The Silver Gull
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Fauna”.
This program shows that the Silver Gulls have a fascinating behaviour and ecology. As well as their interaction with humans, we see their beautiful off-shore island nesting grounds where thousands of birds compete for territory. Sharing this idyllic habitat with the gulls are Sea-Lions, with quaint antics on shore and graceful gymnastics in the water.

results.title: The Silver Greyhound
results.brief_description: The work of the Queen’s Foreign Service messengers, who carry the diplomatic despatches from the Foreign Office in London to British embassies all over the world. In these modern times, we see how he journeys by air - where, for hundreds of years, his predecessors went by post-chaise or on horse-back. In those days, each man carried a pair of pistols and a sword. Today — an outsize passport, printed and bound in red. One thing only persists - the secret token once used as a pass-sign, a relic of the War of the Roses - the Silver Greyhound.

results.title: The Silver fleet
results.creator_credit: Gordon Wellesley, Vernon Sewell, Emeric Pressburger, Michael Powell and Archers Film Productions
results.brief_description: The Silver fleet is a story about occupied Holland, the Dutch resistance movement and a shipping magnate who destroys his U-boat taking himself and his Nazi mentors with it. Stars Ralph Richardson, Googie Withers and Esmond Knight.

results.title: The Silver Cow
results.brief_description: There is a subtle elegance in this traditional Welsh tale about a young cowherd, his harp, and the shining white cow it summons from the depths of a mountain lake. The cowherd’s purity, his struggle with a proud and greedy father, and their inevitable confrontation springs from the author’s childhood travels to Aberdovey, Wales.

results.title: The Silver Brumby. Volume 2
results.creator_credit: John Tatoulis, Colin South and Media World Feature Production
results.brief_description: Features two episodes set in the high country and based on Elyne Mitchell’s book “The Silver brumby”:FLIGHT TO FREEDOM; The beautiful daughter of The Brolga, Boon Boon, proves herself capable of leaving the secure environment of her family when she joins Thowra in a plight to save the brumbies from a brumby hunt: THE OLD PROSPECTOR SAVES A FRIEND; Thowra learns a valuable lesson about humans when evil men set traps in the high country. A friendly prospector helps Silky’s Joey recover after being caught in a trap and proves to Thowra that not all men are bad. However, it will take all of the creatures help, including wombat, to stop more creatures from getting hurt. Features the voices of Charles “Bud” Tingwell, John Stanton, Rebecca Gibney and Marg Downey.
